It's essential to avoid excessive pressure on the abdomen and maintain stability.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"fb5ux33791","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"6igos33792","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Balance issues:","decorations":[{"type":"BOLD","fontWeightValue":700}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":" Low Lunge requires some balance, so if you have difficulty with balance, perform the pose near a wall or with the assistance of a yoga block.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"kc16l33795","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"2m2pm33796","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Neck problems:","decorations":[{"type":"BOLD","fontWeightValue":700}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":" Avoid straining your neck by keeping it aligned with your spine and not overextending or looking upwards.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]}],"bulletedListData":{"indentation":0}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"43rry33799","nodes":[],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"0dl9933833","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Always consult with a qualified yoga instructor or healthcare professional if you have any specific health concerns or conditions before attempting this or any other yoga pose. They can provide personalized advice and modifications to ensure your practice is safe and effective.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}],"metadata":{"version":1,"createdTimestamp":"2023-07-24T03:30:57.952Z","updatedTimestamp":"2023-07-24T03:30:57.952Z","id":"a8d83bcd-06a5-4ee0-823a-049c4dd18090"},"documentStyle":{}}
Options: {"nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"foo","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"If you find Low Lunge challenging or have certain limitations, there are several options and alternatives you can try to modify the pose:","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"ORDERED_LIST","id":"n6goa35078","nodes":[{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"rzrg435079","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"1aarc35080","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"High Lunge:","decorations":[{"type":"BOLD","fontWeightValue":700}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":" Instead of lowering the back knee to the ground, keep it lifted, and stay on the ball of the back foot. This variation reduces pressure on the knee joint and still provides a good stretch for the hip flexors and thighs.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"qv7cf35083","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"sywjm35084","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Crescent Lunge:","decorations":[{"type":"BOLD","fontWeightValue":700}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":" Similar to High Lunge, but with the back foot fully grounded. This option offers more stability and is suitable for those who find balancing difficult.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"rehnm35087","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"r7h6x35088","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Supported Low Lunge:","decorations":[{"type":"BOLD","fontWeightValue":700}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":" Place a folded blanket or cushion under the back knee for extra support and cushioning. This modification is beneficial for sensitive knees or to alleviate discomfort.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"ijn2935091","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"zanj435092","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Hands on a Block:","decorations":[{"type":"BOLD","fontWeightValue":700}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":" If reaching the floor is challenging, rest your hands on yoga blocks on either side of the front foot. This will provide additional length and make the pose more accessible.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"vrckq35095","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"ox04f35096","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Wall Support:","decorations":[{"type":"BOLD","fontWeightValue":700}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":" Perform the Low Lunge facing a wall. Place your hands on the wall for balance and stability, making it easier to maintain the pose.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"55kcw35099","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"nn7it35100","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Lunge with Hands on Hips:","decorations":[{"type":"BOLD","fontWeightValue":700}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":" Instead of raising the arms overhead, keep your hands on your hips. This variation is gentler on the shoulders and more suitable for individuals with shoulder issues.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"t2ido35103","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"rvu7q35104","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Use Props:","decorations":[{"type":"BOLD","fontWeightValue":700}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":" Utilize various yoga props such as straps or a yoga chair for support during the pose, especially if you have limited flexibility or mobility.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"aibku35107","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"oq10635108","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Dynamic Lunges:","decorations":[{"type":"BOLD","fontWeightValue":700}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":" Rather than holding the static pose, perform dynamic lunges by moving in and out of the pose with your breath. This can be less intense and help build strength gradually.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"dg07f35221","nodes":[],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]}],"orderedListData":{"indentation":0}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"2wiza35111","nodes":[],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"x742a35258","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Remember, yoga is about honoring your body's needs and finding modifications that work for you. Choose the variation that feels comfortable and allows you to experience the benefits of the pose without strain or pain","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}],"metadata":{"version":1,"createdTimestamp":"2023-07-24T03:36:50.302Z","updatedTimestamp":"2023-07-24T03:36:50.302Z","id":"407a9326-91be-4da6-a272-03b4b7f63fd1"},"documentStyle":{}}

Title: Side Reclining Leg Lift
Alt Text: How to do Side Reclining Leg Lift Yoga
Short Description: Side-Reclining Leg Lift is a gentle yoga pose where you lie on your side and lift your top leg. It enhances flexibility, strengthens the core, and improves hip mobility.
Notes: {"nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"vnsz858170","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"The Side-Reclining Leg Lift can be done by:","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"ORDERED_LIST","id":"amx1pcom01tbae58905","nodes":[{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"b5epr58906","nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"k56q458907","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Start by lying down on your yoga mat on your right side. Ensure your body is aligned straight from head to heels.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"x3b5acom01tbae58887","nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"q40mm58173","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Rest your head on your right arm, keeping your elbow bent for support. You can place a pillow or blanket under your head for added comfort.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"6kmsgcom01tbae58889","nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"o9wyg58176","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Stack your legs on top of each other, with your right leg on the bottom and your left leg on top.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"vdytccom01tbae58891","nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"edn0p58179","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Position your left hand on the mat in front of your chest for stability.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"rhig0com01tbae58893","nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"k1h3358182","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Inhale deeply and engage your core muscles.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"3u1smcom01tbae58895","nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"gurue58185","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"On your next exhale, lift your left leg up while keeping it straight. Avoid bending the knee to maintain proper alignment.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"cbsmncom01tbae58897","nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"0u2n658188","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Lift the leg as high as is comfortable for you. You should feel a stretch along the outer side of your right hip and thigh.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"907n9com01tbae58899","nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"mn4kf58191","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Hold the lifted leg for a few breaths, maintaining your balance and alignment.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"gqugxcom01tbae58901","nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"75cw358194","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Slowly lower your left leg back down to the starting position on an inhale.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"pu7tpcom01tbae58903","nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"g7g4d58197","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Repeat the same steps on the other side, lying on your left side and lifting your right leg.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}}]}],"orderedListData":{"indentation":0}}],"metadata":{"version":1,"createdTimestamp":"2023-07-24T08:00:31.973Z","updatedTimestamp":"2023-07-24T08:00:31.973Z","id":"cd6d2988-f5da-48aa-95e9-f86e5309f862"},"documentStyle":{}}
Cautions: {"nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"foo","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"While the Side-Reclining Leg Lift yoga pose is generally safe for most people, there are some contraindications and cautions to keep in mind:","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"BULLETED_LIST","id":"dtjld60916","nodes":[{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"lmr5q60827","nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"qhwdq60828","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Recent hip or knee injury:","decorations":[{"type":"BOLD","fontWeightValue":700}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":" Avoid this pose if you have a recent injury to the hips or knees as it may exacerbate the condition.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{}}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"milon60831","nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"40oo160832","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Pregnancy:","decorations":[{"type":"BOLD","fontWeightValue":700}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":" Pregnant individuals should be cautious with this pose, especially during the later stages of pregnancy, as it may put strain on the abdominal muscles and disrupt balance.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"10com60835","nodes":[],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"7k4mu60838","nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"2ygy460839","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Neck or shoulder issues:","decorations":[{"type":"BOLD","fontWeightValue":700}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":" If you have any neck or shoulder problems, be mindful of the pressure on your arm as you rest your head on it. Consider using additional support or modifying the position as needed.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{}}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"um5zs60842","nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"zztz860843","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Lower back sensitivity:","decorations":[{"type":"BOLD","fontWeightValue":700}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":" If you experience discomfort in your lower back during this pose, place a cushion or bolster under your waist for added support.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{}}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"rhbnb60846","nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"l8nw260847","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"High blood pressure:","decorations":[{"type":"BOLD","fontWeightValue":700}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":" Avoid holding your breath during the pose, as it may lead to a spike in blood pressure. Remember to breathe steadily and avoid straining.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{}}]}],"bulletedListData":{"indentation":0}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"nuedq60850","nodes":[],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"azqmy60939","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"As with any yoga practice, it's essential to listen to your body and consult a qualified yoga instructor or healthcare professional if you have any concerns or medical conditions. They can provide personalized guidance and modifications to ensure a safe and effective practice.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}],"metadata":{"version":1,"createdTimestamp":"2023-07-24T08:02:00.735Z","updatedTimestamp":"2023-07-24T08:02:00.735Z","id":"582e9b5a-60b1-4300-ae08-0dd5799a5470"},"documentStyle":{}}
Options: {"nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"foo","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"If you find the Side-Reclining Leg Lift pose challenging or if you have certain limitations, there are alternative variations and options you can explore:","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"BULLETED_LIST","id":"b0cg062008","nodes":[{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"5o7zb61981","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"u15av61982","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Bent Knee Side-Reclining Leg Lift:","decorations":[{"type":"BOLD","fontWeightValue":700}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":" Instead of keeping your top leg straight, bend the knee at a 90-degree angle. Lift the leg as high as comfortable, still engaging the hip and thigh muscles. This modification reduces strain on the hamstring and makes it more accessible for beginners.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"yq5gx61985","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"4lqkf61986","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Supported Side-Reclining Leg Lift:","decorations":[{"type":"BOLD","fontWeightValue":700}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":" Use a yoga block or a folded blanket under your head for added support and comfort. This is especially helpful if you have neck issues or feel discomfort in the upper body.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"on5k761989","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"2w08b61990","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Wall-supported Side-Reclining Leg Lift:","decorations":[{"type":"BOLD","fontWeightValue":700}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":" Perform the pose with your side against a wall. The wall can provide extra support and stability, making it easier to maintain balance during the lift.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"tzg0g61993","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"iekfs61994","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Supine Leg Lifts:","decorations":[{"type":"BOLD","fontWeightValue":700}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":" If lying on your side is uncomfortable, you can perform leg lifts while lying flat on your back (supine position). Lift one leg at a time or both legs together, engaging the core and keeping the lower back grounded.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"b5t9y61997","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"zh4qt61998","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Chair Leg Lifts:","decorations":[{"type":"BOLD","fontWeightValue":700}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":" Sit on a chair and perform leg lifts one at a time. Hold onto the sides of the chair for support and lift your leg, extending it straight or bending the knee as needed.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"xsf9h62001","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"hvkua62002","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Leg Lifts in a Standing Position:","decorations":[{"type":"BOLD","fontWeightValue":700}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":" Stand near a support like a chair or a wall. Hold onto the support for balance and lift your leg to the side. This variation can help strengthen the hip abductor muscles.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]}],"bulletedListData":{"indentation":0}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"co5k362005","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Remember to adjust the pose according to your comfort level and physical capabilities. Always listen to your body and avoid pushing yourself into any position that causes pain or discomfort. It's best to practice under the guidance of a certified yoga instructor, especially when trying new variations or if you have specific health concerns. They can provide personalized modifications and ensure a safe practice for your unique needs.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}],"metadata":{"version":1,"createdTimestamp":"2023-07-24T08:03:27.311Z","updatedTimestamp":"2023-07-24T08:03:27.311Z","id":"b53914ee-7907-4b31-9304-57fe17e1a2be"},"documentStyle":{}}

Title: Half Monkey Pose with Yoga Strap
Alt Text: How to do Half Monkey Pose Half Splits with Yoga Strap
Short Description: The Half Monkey pose, or Ardha Hanumanasana, is a preparatory posture for Full Splits (Hanumanasana). It lengthens the hamstrings, groin, and hip flexors, improves pelvis and hip mobility, and increases pelvic awareness and stability.
Notes: {"nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"0hja841767","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"The Half Monkey pose can be done by:","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"zcu7c41769","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"1. Begin kneeling on the floor with the thighs, knees, shins, ankles, and feet hip distance apart and the tops of the feet flat on the floor or the earth.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"ex9sd41771","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"2. Keep the hip over the knee. Lengthen the right leg out in front of you with the heel on the ground and the toes pointing up towards the sky and flexed towards your face.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"h9avq41773","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"3. Create a loop in the Yoga strap and loop around the flexed foot.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"ftkno41775","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"4. Slide the heel of the foot forward to straighten the right leg (without locking out the knee) and move the hands along the strap accordingly. Rotate the right inner thigh towards the earth so that the kneecap faces the sky. Keep the hips even.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"yuhfi41777","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"5. To move out of the pose, draw the heel back, bend the knee, remove the strap, bring the hands to the floor, and come back to a kneeling position.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"foh7l41779","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"6. Repeat on the other side.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}}],"metadata":{"version":1,"createdTimestamp":"2022-12-05T02:11:35.299Z","updatedTimestamp":"2022-12-05T02:11:35.299Z","id":"dde19930-da03-4565-9161-af16f36df706"},"documentStyle":{}}
Cautions: {"nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"82nae41784","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Read the following cautions to stay safe:","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"b3wmq41787","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"• Do not perform this pose if you have a knee injury and it’s difficult to kneel.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"k422k41790","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"• Never push too far in a pose. Find your edge","decorations":[]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":", but don't move past it","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"","foreground":""}}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":". You should feel the pose working in the body, but still be able to breathe deeply and find some ease in the pose.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"qbjhn41793","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"• If you are concerned about anything with this pose, please consult a physician about whether this practice is good for you.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"zd80l41812","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}}],"metadata":{"version":1,"createdTimestamp":"2022-12-12T03:11:32.924Z","updatedTimestamp":"2022-12-12T03:11:32.924Z","id":"3ee52c58-d37e-4b94-b764-98401030bc84"},"documentStyle":{}}
Options: {"nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0},"style":{},"id":"y4gf841798","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"• Once in the pose, you can lean the torso forward with a straight spine. Keep the length in the spine and the front of the body. Move the hands along the strap towards the feet.","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"","foreground":""}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0},"style":{},"id":"qw6al41801","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"• A different option is to move the backside towards the heel of the back foot.","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"","foreground":""}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0},"style":{},"id":"kull141804","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"• If you feel unbalanced, hold the strap ends in one hand and use the other hand to steady yourself using a wall, or a chair.","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"","foreground":""}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0},"style":{},"id":"8qf6w41807","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"• If doing this pose without the Yoga strap, you could try using blocks, or finger tips on the floor, or try bringing one hand or both hands on top of the straight leg.","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"","foreground":""}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0},"style":{},"id":"91faj41810","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"• If it feels uncomfortable to kneel, use padding underneath the knees.","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"","foreground":""}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}],"metadata":{"version":1,"createdTimestamp":"2022-12-05T02:15:26.821Z","updatedTimestamp":"2022-12-05T02:15:26.821Z","id":"8717aa3d-d213-4f44-8e57-c74c2264f7f1"},"documentStyle":{}}

Title: Side Lunge
Alt Text: How to do Side Lunge Yoga
Short Description: Skandasana, or Side Lunge Pose, is a yoga posture that involves a deep lateral stretch. It enhances hip flexibility, strengthens legs, and opens groins for improved mobility and balance.
Notes: {"nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"foo","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"The Side Lunge Pose, or Skandasana, can be done by:","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"ORDERED_LIST","id":"3g9zn52887","nodes":[{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"4e2fe52888","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"zqqto52889","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Begin in a standing position (Mountain Pose) with your feet together and arms at your sides.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"4dhum52891","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"ge5ic52892","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Inhale deeply, then take a wide step to the right with your right foot, turning your right toes outward.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"26lys52894","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"t3rd352895","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"As you exhale, bend your right knee, lowering your hips into a lunge position. Keep your left leg straight and engaged.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"6fs8d52897","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"9xwnf52898","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Place both hands on the floor inside your right foot. You can use yoga blocks for support if needed.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"8l71d52900","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"9ler452901","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Now, shift your weight to the right foot, and lift your left foot off the ground. Your left leg should be straight and parallel to the floor.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"6hacc52903","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"gv8h452904","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Keep your chest lifted and gaze forward, maintaining a tall spine throughout the pose.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"7icuc52906","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"s4svn52907","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"If you feel comfortable and balanced, you can experiment with different arm positions. One option is to place your hands in prayer position (Anjali Mudra) at your heart center.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"d9sh052909","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"9mst852910","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Hold the pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute, breathing deeply and evenly.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"uvvk852912","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"q4o2m52913","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"To release the pose, engage your core, press through your right foot, and step back to the starting position.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"f2qa852915","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"60ekx52916","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Repeat the same steps on the other side, stepping out with your left foot and bending your left knee into a lunge.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]}],"orderedListData":{"indentation":0}}],"metadata":{"version":1,"createdTimestamp":"2023-07-24T05:51:35.983Z","updatedTimestamp":"2023-07-24T05:51:35.983Z","id":"6631bd0b-c823-4ae6-9f25-62af0a7355cf"},"documentStyle":{}}
Cautions: {"nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"foo","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Read the following cautions to stay safe:","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"j2lg554033","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Skandasana (Side Lunge Pose) is generally a safe and beneficial pose, but there are some contraindications and cautions to consider:","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"zeen054038","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"1. Knee injuries: Avoid Skandasana if you have acute or chronic knee injuries, such as ligament tears or meniscus issues. The deep lunge position may exacerbate these conditions.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"f0ufq54040","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"2. Hip issues: If you have hip problems, like hip impingement or labral tears, this pose may not be suitable. It can place stress on the hip joint, leading to discomfort or injury.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"2edt354042","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"3. Ankle instability: If you have weak or unstable ankles, be cautious with this pose, as it requires balance and stability on one foot.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"6idms54044","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"4. Pregnancy: Pregnant women should approach this pose with caution, especially as their center of gravity shifts. Modifications may be necessary to ensure safety and comfort.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"v6gsk54124","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"5. Hamstring tightness: If you have tight hamstrings, you might feel strain in the straight leg during the pose. To avoid this, keep a slight bend in the knee of the straight leg or use yoga props like blocks for support.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"5jewi54050","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"6. Balance issues: Skandasana requires balance on one leg, which might be challenging for some practitioners. Practicing near a wall or using a chair for support can be helpful.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"yvedp54052","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"7. Lower back issues: If you have lower back problems, avoid rounding your spine during the pose. Engage your core and maintain a long, neutral spine to protect the lower back.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"c22ef54054","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"8. Groin or adductor strain: If you have a groin or adductor injury, proceed with caution in this pose. Gradually ease into the stretch and avoid forcing your range of motion.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"l5zcw54228","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"pfpci54056","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Always listen to your body and respect its limits. If you have any concerns about whether Skandasana is suitable for you, it's best to consult a qualified yoga instructor or healthcare professional before attempting the pose. They can provide personalized guidance and adjustments based on your individual needs and limitations.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}}],"metadata":{"version":1,"createdTimestamp":"2023-07-24T05:54:41.714Z","updatedTimestamp":"2023-07-24T05:54:41.714Z","id":"f3dd4cda-b9a8-45b6-9ee9-7b4074f6c2f1"},"documentStyle":{}}
Options: {"nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"foo","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"There are several alternatives and options you can explore with Skandasana to make the pose more accessible or to add variations to your practice. Here are some alternatives and modifications:","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"ORDERED_LIST","id":"ify2t55399","nodes":[{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"shaht55400","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"n080f55401","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Supported Skandasana","decorations":[{"type":"BOLD","fontWeightValue":700}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":": If you find it challenging to balance in the full expression of Skandasana, you can place a yoga block under your sitting bones for support. This will allow you to focus on the stretch without worrying about balance.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"pn9ff55404","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"rcqac55405","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Hand on the floor","decorations":[{"type":"BOLD","fontWeightValue":700}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":": Instead of placing both hands on the floor inside your front foot, you can keep one hand on the floor and extend the other arm upward, creating a side stretch. This variation is gentler on the hips and offers a different type of opening.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"67fu255408","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"rvbmk55409","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Hand on the knee","decorations":[{"type":"BOLD","fontWeightValue":700}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":": To reduce the intensity of the pose, place one hand on the bent knee for support. This modification is especially helpful if you have knee issues or limited flexibility.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"w8b6055412","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"kbht155413","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Using a wall or chair","decorations":[{"type":"BOLD","fontWeightValue":700}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":": Practicing Skandasana near a wall or using a chair for support can provide stability and help you maintain balance while working on your hip flexibility.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"2f8en55416","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"we89155417","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Dynamic movement","decorations":[{"type":"BOLD","fontWeightValue":700}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":": Instead of holding the pose statically, you can incorporate dynamic movement. From Skandasana, shift your weight to the other side, moving back and forth between the right and left sides. This flowing variation can be a great way to warm up and open the hips.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"uyolh55420","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"jxbrr55421","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Half Skandasana","decorations":[{"type":"BOLD","fontWeightValue":700}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":": Perform the pose with both feet on the ground, but with a less deep bend in the knees. This variation is useful for those with limited flexibility in the hips or knees.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"zvmms55424","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"py4hm55425","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Seated Skandasana","decorations":[{"type":"BOLD","fontWeightValue":700}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":": If the standing version is challenging, you can practice Skandasana seated on the floor. Sit with your legs wide apart, bend one knee, and extend the other leg straight out to the side. Repeat on the other side.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]}],"orderedListData":{"indentation":0}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"i6b1y55428","nodes":[],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"36m0h55445","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Remember that every body is different, and it's essential to choose the variation that suits your level of flexibility and comfort. As you progress in your yoga practice, you may find that you can explore deeper variations of Skandasana. Always honor your body and avoid pushing yourself into a position that causes pain or discomfort. If you're unsure about which modification is suitable for you, consider seeking guidance from a qualified yoga instructor.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}],"metadata":{"version":1,"createdTimestamp":"2023-07-24T06:03:33.833Z","updatedTimestamp":"2023-07-24T06:03:33.833Z","id":"6509cc1d-7f47-4140-8c5f-78c58d5f8f03"},"documentStyle":{}}

Title: Revolved Head-to-Knee Pose with Yoga Strap
Alt Text: How to do Revolved Head-to-Knee Pose with Yoga Strap
Short Description: Revolved Head-to-Knee pose, or Parivrtta Janu Sirsasana, is a deep side stretch coupled with a heart-opening twist. It lengthens the hamstring and stretches the groin and inner leg. It also stretches the spine and shoulder, stimulates your abdominal organs, and improves overall digestion.
Notes: {"nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"6m8w563236","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Revolved Head-to-Knee pose can be done by:","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"df6q563238","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"1. Begin by sitting in Wide-Angle Seated Forward Bend pose (Upavistha Konasana), with sitting bones grounded and without locking the knees. Sit tall and extend the crown of the head towards the sky.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"j2f3p63240","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"2. Bend the right knee and bring the heel in to your left leg/groin.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"kuvck63242","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"3. Turn the toes on the straight leg up towards the sky and flex the foot. Hug the muscles to the bones in that leg.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"6ublz63244","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"4. Lengthen your spine and bring your left hand to the inside of your left leg, palm facing out.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"pgw1863246","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"5. Have the strap in your right hand and loop the strap around the left foot.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"pc63h63248","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"6. Peel back the right-shoulder to open the heart, bringing the right arm above the head.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"l6i2m63250","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"7. Move the hand along the strap to deepen the side stretch. Lengthen both sides of the waist.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"0x4ih63252","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"8. Look up towards the sky, underneath the armpit.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"fjvwr63254","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"9. Repeat on the other side.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}}],"metadata":{"version":1,"createdTimestamp":"2022-12-05T02:50:17.472Z","updatedTimestamp":"2022-12-05T02:50:17.472Z","id":"dbdf84c0-524a-4ba3-aece-16909785a482"},"documentStyle":{}}
Cautions: {"nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"mw7mr63259","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Read the following cautions to stay safe:","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"nty8463262","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"• If you have a knee injury or it’s otherwise too uncomfortable to bend one leg, you can keep both legs straight and practise the same upper body actions.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"1r0pb63265","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"• Never push too far in a pose. Find your edge","decorations":[]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":", but don't move past it","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"","foreground":""}}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":". You should feel the pose working in the body, but still be able to breathe deeply and find some ease in the pose.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"ft4n863268","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"• In order to protect the lower back, it is important to have a straight spine when you begin this pose, and to do the pose without rounding through the back or slouching. If you need to, sit on a folded blanket, or a block, or have a bend in the leg that is out wide. If you are rounding your spine, or slouching, try moving the left hand further up the leg towards the body.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"v6t9v63271","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"• If you have discomfort in your neck, don’t look up. Instead, keep your gaze on the floor in front of you.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"639uj63274","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"• If you are concerned about anything with this pose, please consult a physician about whether this practice is good for you.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}}],"metadata":{"version":1,"createdTimestamp":"2022-12-12T03:10:28.821Z","updatedTimestamp":"2022-12-12T03:10:28.821Z","id":"073cf43b-a7a3-46f7-9c6a-0f3c7ed8ad8e"},"documentStyle":{}}
Options: {"nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0},"style":{},"id":"ffw7263277","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"• You can place your hand on the floor, or on a block on the inside of the outstretched leg.","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"","foreground":""}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0},"style":{},"id":"3iftb63282","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"• Keep the knee bent on the outstretched leg if your hamstrings are tight. You can also place a block rolled-up towel or folded blanket underneath the bent knee on the outstretched leg, and under the bent leg knee if the leg is mostly off the floor.","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"","foreground":""}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0},"style":{},"id":"8fc4t63285","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"• With the strap you can use one hand to hold both of the ends of the Yoga strap, or you can hold one end of the Yoga strap in each hand.","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"","foreground":""}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0},"style":{},"id":"mji2363289","nodes":[],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}],"metadata":{"version":1,"createdTimestamp":"2022-12-05T02:51:34.529Z","updatedTimestamp":"2022-12-05T02:51:34.529Z","id":"2904df50-9dac-4d7d-b2a1-d4bdce4d016d"},"documentStyle":{}}

Title: Pigeon Pose
Alt Text: How to do Pigeon Pose Yoga
Short Description: The Pigeon Pose, or Ardha Kapotasana, works on stretching and strengthening the legs, hips, and spine.
Notes: {"nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"foo","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"The Pigeon Pose can be done by:  ","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"3ddkg","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"1. Begin on your hands and knees.  ","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"1agnn","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"2. Bring your right knee to the front, just behind your right hand and place the outside of your right foot on the floor, close to your left hand.  ","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"7nfrv","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"3. Now slowly lower your right knee down, while sliding your left leg back behind you, with the top of your left foot on the floor. If you need, you can support your right hip with a blanket or cushion.  ","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"4mmsq","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"4. Ground the palms of your hands close to your hips and start to lengthen and lift your pelvic floor muscles, lower belly, and upper body.  ","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"b0dmg","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"5. From here, see if you can start to pull the chest slightly up, while you keep dropping the weight of your shoulders down. You want to keep your neck aligned with your spine and keep the chin slightly tucked into your chest.  ","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"fm25t","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"6. Keep activating your back leg and draw the right hip back, as the left hip reaches a little forward.  ","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"22qqd","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"7. Stay in this position for at least five long and deep breaths, with the gaze of your eyes looking softly down in front of you.  ","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"cpika","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"8. Release the position by pressing into the palms of your hands and lifting the hips to come back towards your hands and knees. From here, change and do the left side.  ","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"cv4q6","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"9. Bring your left knee to the front just behind your left hand and place the outside of your left foot on the floor close to your right hand.  ","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"3lrm6","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"10. Now slowly lower your left knee down, while sliding your right leg back behind you, with the top of your right foot on the floor. Again, if you need you can support your right hip with a blanket or cushion.  ","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"f0l3k","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"11. Ground the palms of your hands close to your hips and start to lengthen and lift your pelvic floor muscles, lower belly, and upper body.  ","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"eq37e","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"12. Again, see if you can start to pull the chest slightly up, while you keep dropping the weight of your shoulders down. You want to keep your neck aligned with your spine and keep the chin slightly tucked into your chest.  ","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"9eead","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"13. Keep activating your back leg and draw the left hip back as the right hip reaches a little forward.  ","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"f2spd","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"14. Stay in this position for at least five long and deep breaths, with the gaze of your eyes looking softly down in front of you.  ","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"1cvii","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"15. Release the position by pressing into the palms of your hands and lifting the hips to come back towards your hands and knees.  ","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}}],"metadata":{"version":1,"createdTimestamp":"2022-12-05T02:39:04.731Z","updatedTimestamp":"2022-12-05T02:39:04.731Z","id":"abfe7e38-b811-4a66-b694-340a7627d26c"},"documentStyle":{}}
Cautions: {"nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0},"style":{},"id":"2apbn","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Read the following cautions to stay safe:  ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"","foreground":""}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0},"style":{},"id":"7hbh4","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"• Do not perform this exercise when you have a knee or ankle injury.  ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"","foreground":""}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0},"style":{},"id":"3lbb6","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"• If you are concerned about anything with this pose, please contact your physician about whether this practice is good for you.  ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"","foreground":""}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}],"metadata":{"version":1,"createdTimestamp":"2022-12-05T02:44:03.875Z","updatedTimestamp":"2022-12-05T02:44:03.875Z","id":"8a7478a9-d2ce-41d6-a357-17975a6a019b"},"documentStyle":{}}
Options: {"nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0},"style":{},"id":"do5b7","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"• You can make this position easier by supporting the hip with a rolled-up blanket or one or two cushions.","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"","foreground":""}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}],"metadata":{"version":1,"createdTimestamp":"2022-12-05T02:44:24.508Z","updatedTimestamp":"2022-12-05T02:44:24.508Z","id":"fbb96ae1-9695-4427-9857-c3ec2305691a"},"documentStyle":{}}

Title: Standing Forward Bend
Alt Text: How to do a Standing Forward Bend Yoga
Short Description: The Standing Forward Bend Pose or Uttanasana opens and lengthens the back of the legs, and keeps the spine strong and flexible.
Notes: {"nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"foo","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"The Standing Forward Bend Pose can be done by: ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent"}}]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"n1l6x69488","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"1. Start by standing tall with your arms relaxed by your sides. Try grounding the body by feeling your leg muscles and adjusting them slightly if it feels needed. Keep a slight bend in the knees as you begin to prepare for folding forward. ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent"}}]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"pjr1g69736","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"2. When you are ready, begin to exhale as you draw your belly back and up and then fold forward from the hips, while keeping the torso lengthened. ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent"}}]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"ynvog70012","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"3. To begin with, you can keep the knees bent and release any tension you might feel in the lower back. Let your arms softly hang down or take hold of your opposite elbows. ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent"}}]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"b44ai70316","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"4. Keep breathing and bring attention to the lengthening of your torso on every inhale, and then when exhaling try to come a little deeper into the pose. ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent"}}]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"kwf1t70648","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"5. Allow the weight of your head to drop heavily down, and, if it feels comfortable for your hamstrings, extend your hips slightly further up and back, so that the legs begin to straighten a little more. ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent"}}]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"gmgnk71008","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"6. Keep your gaze looking towards your nose, as you stay here for at least five long and deep breaths. ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent"}}]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"wbof871396","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"7. To come out of the pose, bend your knees slightly and lift the torso up while keeping a neutral and straight spine. Finally, coming back to a standing position. ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent"}}]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}}],"metadata":{"version":1,"createdTimestamp":"2022-12-05T03:10:29.499Z","updatedTimestamp":"2022-12-05T03:10:29.499Z","id":"016fa490-bc18-429a-9513-c91919530935"},"documentStyle":{}}
Cautions: {"nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0},"style":{},"id":"qaw6m67900","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Read the following cautions to stay safe: ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":""}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0},"style":{},"id":"ow5ua68058","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"• Do not perform this position when you have a back injury, see ‘Making the pose easier’ for a modified and easier version of this pose. ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":""}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0},"style":{},"id":"woksu68244","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"• If you are concerned about anything with this pose, please consult a physician about whether this practice is good for you. ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":""}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}],"metadata":{"version":1,"createdTimestamp":"2022-12-05T03:10:54.258Z","updatedTimestamp":"2022-12-05T03:10:54.258Z","id":"fcab02c2-1937-4644-ae0b-89cd132789d9"},"documentStyle":{}}
Options: {"nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0},"style":{},"id":"2ni1l67455","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"• You can bend the knees, either slightly or even so deeply that your belly starts to rest on your thighs. Additionally, you could slowly reduce the angle of your bend every time you practice this pose. ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":""}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0},"style":{},"id":"r58rx67575","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"• If you really have difficulty with your balance, you could try to place your hands on the wall and fold forward so that your hips, shoulders, and arms are in one line. Another alternative is to try the seated forward bend pose.","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":""}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}],"metadata":{"version":1,"createdTimestamp":"2022-12-05T03:23:31.459Z","updatedTimestamp":"2022-12-05T03:23:31.459Z","id":"535f57d6-3d98-4a7d-be6a-0e4f51ad5512"},"documentStyle":{}}

Title: Reclining Bound Angle Pose with Yoga Strap
Alt Text: How to do Reclining Bound Angle Pose with Yoga Strap
Short Description: Reclining Bound Angle pose, or Supta Baddha Konasana, is a classic restorative lying-down yoga pose that opens the groin, the inner thighs and the hips.
Notes: {"nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"foo","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Reclining Bound Angle pose can be done by:","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"uo9v07011","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"1. Begin by sitting on the Yoga mat.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"nifk97013","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"2. Make sure the Feelix Yoga strap is completely unfurled.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"2pwqj7015","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"3. Run the Feelix Yoga strap through slot one on the lock and pull the strap all the way through until the lock reaches the rivet.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"wokzd7017","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"4. Take the strap behind your body and close the lock by threading the strap up through slot two, down through slot three.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"uusc17019","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"5. Draw the soles of your feet together and let the knees drop out to the side then take the strap over the knees under the feet.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"4wxfb7021","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"6. Move the wood lock to somewhere comfortable.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"gwxbv7023","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"7. Tighten or loosen the strap by pulling the loose end through slots 2/3.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"ajo7u7025","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"8. Slowly come to recline on your back by coming onto your elbows first.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"a5mdb7027","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"9. Lengthen the sides of the body. Lift and lengthen the tailbone and place back down on the mat. Roll the outer edges of the shoulders under so you can send the shoulder blades down the back towards the tailbone.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"apb6q7029","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"10.Let the arms come out to the side at 45 degrees, palms facing up.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"tac0w7031","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"11. Close your eyes.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"m5qe27033","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}}],"metadata":{"version":1,"createdTimestamp":"2022-12-12T05:29:10.882Z","updatedTimestamp":"2022-12-12T05:29:10.882Z","id":"a3975d80-6a3f-49ee-8829-5d054829d04c"},"documentStyle":{}}
Cautions: {"nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"foo","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Read the following cautions to stay safe:","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"m1axh9439","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"• It’s best to avoid this pose if you have a knee, hip or groin injury. ","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"o24ry9441","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"• Don’t push the knees down towards the floor. Never push too far in a pose. Find your edge, but don't move past it. You should feel the pose working in the body, but still be able to breathe deeply and find some ease in the pose.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"jm6cs9443","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"• If you are concerned about anything with this pose, please consult a physician about whether this practice is good for you.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"yr28z9445","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}}],"metadata":{"version":1,"createdTimestamp":"2022-12-12T03:09:50.683Z","updatedTimestamp":"2022-12-12T03:09:50.683Z","id":"2e14a7d4-cbbb-453a-b602-9698067108fa"},"documentStyle":{}}
Options: {"nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"foo","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"• If there is strain or too ","decorations":[]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"much discomfort","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"","foreground":""}}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":", use blankets under the outer upper thighs.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"hw7239869","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"• You can also use blanket or cushion support under the upper back, neck and head.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"jgcgr9871","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"• Try lying back on a bolster, with the sitting bones still on the floor. This is a particularly beneficial way of doing the pose during pregnancy.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"8fy029873","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"• To ","decorations":[]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"deepen","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"","foreground":""}}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":" this pose, try bringing the arms overhead, either straight or holding the elbows.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"rz48s9877","nodes":[],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}],"metadata":{"version":1,"createdTimestamp":"2022-12-12T01:41:26.431Z","updatedTimestamp":"2022-12-12T01:41:26.431Z","id":"82fc437f-e6e9-45d9-a577-ec470fe087fd"},"documentStyle":{}}

Title: Revolved Abdomen Pose
Alt Text: How to do Revolved Abdomen Pose Supine Twist Yoga
Short Description: Revolved Abdomen Pose  involves lying on your back and twisting your lower body to one side, promoting spinal mobility, relieving tension, and improving digestion.
Notes: {"nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"foo","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Revolved Abdomen Pose can be done by:","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"ORDERED_LIST","id":"9b8v145669","nodes":[{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"vb3tz45670","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"5txm745671","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Start by lying on your back on a comfortable yoga mat or a soft surface. Extend your legs straight out in front of you, with your arms resting alongside your body, palms facing down.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"grtbq45673","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"pktcl45674","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Take a few deep breaths to relax and ground yourself.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"s7en545676","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"3icb945677","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Bend your knees and draw them up toward your chest. Keep your feet together and knees close to your torso.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"1ffd345679","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"zo8yi45680","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"On an exhale, gently drop both knees over to the right side of your body. Your thighs may or may not touch the ground, depending on your flexibility. Keep your shoulders and back relaxed.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"i9ndj45682","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"glhhi45683","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Extend your arms out to the sides in a T shape, with your palms facing up. This helps to open your chest and shoulders.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"s8ryg45685","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"0psps45686","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Ensure your head is in a neutral position, looking straight up or turning it to the left for a deeper stretch.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"exx6045688","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"p6bkb45689","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Stay in the pose for about 30 seconds to 1 minute, breathing deeply and allowing your body to relax into the twist.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"po81945691","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"3m0av45692","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"To release the pose, inhale and draw your knees back to the center.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"y7guy45694","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"j7o2t45695","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Repeat the twist on the other side by exhaling and dropping your knees to the left while keeping your upper body relaxed.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"anenc45697","nodes":[{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"nl6i445698","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"After completing both sides, hug your knees to your chest once again for a brief moment to neutralize your spine.","decorations":[]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"}]}],"orderedListData":{"indentation":0}}],"metadata":{"version":1,"createdTimestamp":"2023-07-24T05:39:34.057Z","updatedTimestamp":"2023-07-24T05:39:34.057Z","id":"295458c7-7e71-49f4-a263-596c708802a8"},"documentStyle":{}}
Cautions: {"nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"foo","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Read the following cautions to stay safe:","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"ORDERED_LIST","id":"mnzma0q3a9kfbe47778","nodes":[{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"hj39r0q3a9kfbe47764","nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"igh0s46652","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Pregnancy: Avoid this pose if you are pregnant, especially in the later stages, as it involves twisting the abdomen, which could put pressure on the uterus.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"9h6p20q3a9kfbe47766","nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"3t0ed46655","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Recent abdominal surgery: If you have had abdominal surgery recently, avoid this pose until you have fully healed and received clearance from your healthcare provider.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"k3r4a0q3a9kfbe47768","nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"5bs6446658","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Severe back or spinal issues: If you have severe back pain, disc herniation, or other spinal problems, it's best to avoid deep twisting poses like Jathara Parivartanasana. Consult with a healthcare professional or yoga therapist for personalized guidance.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"b01320q3a9kfbe47770","nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"5zjgf46664","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Knee or hip injuries: If you have knee or hip injuries or discomfort, take caution when performing this pose. You can modify the twist or use props like a blanket or bolster to support your knees.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"ef2kr0q3a9kfbe47772","nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"sxk8h46667","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Neck issues: Be mindful of your neck during the twist. If you have neck pain or injuries, avoid turning your head too far to either side. Keep your neck in a neutral position or use a small pillow or folded towel for support.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"4y0hi0q3a9kfbe47774","nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"8ujqg46670","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"High or low blood pressure: During the twist, there may be a temporary change in blood pressure. If you have hypertension or low blood pressure, come out of the pose gently if you feel any dizziness or discomfort.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}}]},{"type":"LIST_ITEM","id":"ohyn20q3a9kfbe47776","nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"jtz6j46673","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Menstruation: Some women may find twisting poses uncomfortable during menstruation. Listen to your body and modify the pose if needed.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"45whh47789","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}}]}],"orderedListData":{"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"j8tkx46675","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"bdqp847827","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Always inform your yoga instructor about any existing medical conditions or injuries before starting a yoga practice. If you are practicing at home, it's a good idea to consult with a healthcare professional or an experienced yoga teacher to ensure the pose is suitable for your individual needs and health condition. Additionally, if you experience pain, discomfort, or any adverse effects while practicing the pose, stop immediately and seek guidance.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}}],"metadata":{"version":1,"createdTimestamp":"2023-07-24T05:45:17.766Z","updatedTimestamp":"2023-07-24T05:45:17.766Z","id":"29d1dcf7-61bc-4ecd-b51f-29caefaa01d8"},"documentStyle":{}}
Options: {"nodes":[{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"foo","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"If you find Jathara Parivartanasana (Reclined Abdomen Twist Pose) challenging or have certain limitations that make it difficult to perform, there are several alternatives and options that can provide similar benefits. Here are some alternative poses and modifications:","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"},"indentation":0}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"l1vdc49832","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"1. Supine Knee-to-Chest Pose: Lie on your back and bring one knee at a time toward your chest, holding it with both hands. This helps gently stretch the lower back and abdomen without the intensity of a full twist.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"csf9t49834","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"2. Gentle Supine Twist: Instead of dropping both knees to one side, keep your knees bent and drop them to one side at a time. This reduces the intensity of the twist while still offering a beneficial stretch.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"tjurc49836","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"3. Reclined Spinal Twist with Knee Support: Place a bolster or folded blanket under your knees while in the twist to provide extra support and reduce strain on the lower back and hips.","decorations":[]}}],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"rwohf49838","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"4.
